org.apparatus_templi

Class SerialConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.SerialConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummySerialConnection, UsbSerialConnection

    public abstract class SerialConnection
extends Object
implements gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener
    An abstract class that defines all methods that a serial connection must implement.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void close()
      Shutdown the connection.
      protected abstract void initialize(String preferredConnection) 
      abstract boolean isConnected()
      Returns the current state of the connection.
      (package private) abstract boolean isDataAvailable()
      Returns true if any data is available for reading, false otherwise.

      Read a single byte of data from the serial connection.
      (package private) abstract boolean writeData(byte[] data)
      Writes the given array of bytes to the serial line using whatever method is appropriate for the sub-classing connection.

      • initialize

        protected abstract void initialize(String preferredConnection)

      • isConnected

        public abstract boolean isConnected()

      • close

        public abstract void close()
        Shutdown the connection.

      • isDataAvailable

        abstract boolean isDataAvailable()
        Returns true if any data is available for reading, false otherwise.

      • readInputByte

        abstract int readInputByte()
                    throws IOException
        Read a single byte of data from the serial connection. The byte data is returned as a signed integer value.
        Returns:
        the signed integer representation of the read byte. If the byte was read correctly then this value will be between 0-255. If the byte could not be read then will return a value of -1.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the serial connection could not be read from.

      • writeData

        abstract boolean writeData(byte[] data)
        Writes the given array of bytes to the serial line using whatever method is appropriate for the sub-classing connection.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to write to the serial line.
        Returns:
        true if the data was written to the serial line, false otherwise.
